co-sponsor partner Propose Day special: Here’s how Sofia Hayat and other celebs plan to direct a proposal scene tv Updated: Feb 08, 2017 10:06 IST HT Correspondent As you make your grand plans on popping the question to your special one, model-turned-saint Sofia Hayat tells us how she would like a proposal scene to be - that is, if they ever don the director’s hat! (Instagram) 
The drama and revelry around what the millenial believes is the ‘Valentine Week’ has begun with Rose Day that was celebrated on Tuesday. Now, Wednesday is supposed to be ‘Propose Day’. Read more 
As you make your grand plans on popping the question to your special one, we asked a few celebs to describe their ideal proposal scene and how would their ideal romantic film be. TV actors Sara Khan, Tanya Sharma, Parineeta Borthakur and model-turned-saint Sofia Hayat tell us how they would like a proposal scene to be - that is, if they ever don the director’s hat! 
Sofia Hayat 
I will direct a movie where God takes birth to help the earth and spread love all around once again. In my movie it will be how a man and woman, fall in love and help the society when they accomplish the reason of their birth. They move on to temple and propose each other and remember their own identity. 
Sara Khan 
I would like to direct the scene with normal dose of masala action and a cute item number before the guy proposes the girl. Hero will first fight the antagonist and they meet crying to hug and pamper each other and with little comedy, he will propose. 
Tanya Sharma 
I will direct a romantic thriller about a lawyer (hero) who saves a criminal (heroine) from a murder case. Sorting the case they will fall in love and at the end when he wins the case and saves the girl. She proposes, the hero and asks him to marry her with romantic dialogue. 
Parineeta Borthakur 
The girl in my movie would meet the guy on some social media platform and they keep chatting all day along. At last they would propose, but without words. As duo understands they are made for each other. Simple and creative! 
Mahika Verma 
I would love to direct a romantic horror thriller. The couple meets running away from a ghost and they help each other and plan to fight spirit and when they defeat it they understand the need for each other in their life and plan to be forever together. 
Veer Aryan 
I will direct a scene where the man takes the girl to an island on a yacht and says “Even if I was stuck here for the rest of my life on an island there wouldn’t be anyone else I would want to be, but with you!”
